learning_outcomes.description: Explain the terminology and concepts that are the fundamental building blocks of current and emerging business information systems.
Analyse and evaluate the role of business information systems in organisations.
Utilise problem solving strategies to analyse and solve authentic business information system challenges.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment will centre on evaluating your understanding of information systems.

You will be required to answer questions in essay format, based on a case study.

Please note that this is an individual assignment and will be progressively discussed in weekly seminars.

AI Statement:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the Submission icon in the assessment link on the Blackboard course.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
Progressive In-Tutorial Worksheets - Week 2 - Week 10

Final Excel Workbook - 3PM - 8/05/2026
assessments.category: Notebook/ Logbook, Practical/ Demonstration, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description:
This assessment will center on evaluating your understanding of Excel

The assignment specifications will be distributed around Week 6.

You will be required to work on a provided excel spreadsheet following provided instructions to answer given questions.

Please note that this is an individual assignment and will be progressively discussed in weekly seminars.

AI Statement:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This is an invigilated, closed-book exam held on-campus focusing on work covered in the course.

The exam comprises short answer, multiple choice and problem solving questions.

AI Statement:

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
